Intercepted in a rogue casino, the key uses two secretive "blum" numbers. Can you recover the original message from 2571421140197833988072420101021207361656318729804013081954377487522792954153789106587575436617375575900261751879813881063497597771062813417205374168222372 and uncover the vulnerability?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=11780425341267177806517381178889949592373438346685875241431074800703147315969053235700521842450072092889016077612809589440063109873215997679187642717287657, e=5759297957362310313587939666208755062151002802785248957863458821681792286075712417027970442010196204860693822110065368769534397177739396747146213070059027
The lower 104 bits of p are: 62827708653825454083981283153156147555


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{yukawyju}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 2571421140197833988072420101021207361656318729804013081954377487522792954153789106587575436617375575900261751879813881063497597771062813417205374168222372
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=11780425341267177806517381178889949592373438346685875241431074800703147315969053235700521842450072092889016077612809589440063109873215997679187642717287657, e=5759297957362310313587939666208755062151002802785248957863458821681792286075712417027970442010196204860693822110065368769534397177739396747146213070059027
The lower 104 bits of p are: 62827708653825454083981283153156147555

extra_info: p=103304290916893960002707317238244580257522021961231641178864094478832607594851, q=114036166713968077459496321435804546347070212489938100570665367984425026928707, Ï†(n)=11780425341267177806517381178889949592373438346685875241431074800703147315968835895242890980412609889250342028486204997205611940131466468216724385082764100
